title: Which is the best submachine gun in the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Largely a personal preference , performance/reliability question Certainly Israeli manufactured Uzi 9mm submachine gunhttps://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uzi And numerous Heckler Koch submachine guns are standard for elite forces worldwide https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_MP7https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_MP5https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kommando_Spezialkr%C3%A4ftehttps://navyseals.com/weapons-demo/mp5/Why does the FBI arms their SWAT team members with a Heckler & Koch MP5 sub-machine gun as well as a Springfield .45 caliber pistol? Additionally Heckler and Koch has a limited production cartridgeless submachine gun that is exclusively for German GSG 9 production is specifically limited by arms treaty imposed on Germany. GSG 9 - Wikipedia Don't discount Mac-10 or Mac-11https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC-10https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC-11 Either Of course the Thompson submachine gun desires an honorable, most honorable mention. Thompson submachine gun - Wikipedia

I like the H&K MP5. I’ve never been in combat, don’t have any desire to be either, but I’ve fired MP5s, Thompsons, Uzis, MP40s, MP34s, MP38/42s, ERMAs, PPSH41s, Grease Guns, STEN Guns, Vz 25s, VP70Zs, M2 Carbines, and once a selective fire Walther PP at machine gun shoots. The MP5 was tops in my opinion. Mostly because the others were from WW2 and fired from an open bolt. Let’s just say that they weren’t designed for accuracy. The MP5, on the other hand, was smooth as silk and you could keep it right on target. Shooting them is fun fun fun! Shooting the others was fun too, but the MP5 was spectacular. I’m not certain that there are a lot of people manufacturing machine pistols anymore, I can only think of the MP5 offhand. I don't think they’re really relevant in warfare today, so the MP5 is easily on top for that reason as well.
